etymology.description: Pictogram: bull’s head with two horns and two ears; perhaps unrelated to 告; unrelated to 先.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a bull’s head with prominent horns and ears, a direct visual rendering of the animal. Stylization over time simplified the lines, but the bovine shape remains evident.

examples.chinese: 这头牛很壮(這頭牛很壯)。
牛奶很新鲜(牛奶很新鮮)。
牧民在草原上赶牛(牧民在草原上趕牛)。
examples.pinyin: Mùmín zài cǎoyuán shàng gǎn niú.
examples.english: The herders drive cattle on the grassland.
